sentences: Pan Shiji or Chew Shyh-Ji (Chinese: 潘世姬; born 29 July 1957) is a Taiwanese composer, writer and music educator.
Pan Shiji was born in Taipei, and her family emigrated to Canada in 1974.
She took piano lessons and studied composition with Hsu Tsang-houei in Taiwan.

In Canada, she studied composition with Robert Turner at the University of Manitoba from 1976 to 80 and then in America studying with Chou Wen-chung at Columbia University, New York, from 1980 to 1988.
In 1988, she returned to Taiwan and took a position as professor of composition at the National Academy of the Arts.
